issue.title: Problem with camera when instantiating two of the same robot type

content.raw:
I’ve switched to doing source builds of ignition-blueprint, ros1-ign-bridge, and subt so that I could test this, and this pull request did not fix the issue.

I'm specifically using the `remap_default_topics` branch of `subt` and the `remove_world_name` branch of `ign-gazebo` since it appears the `ign-sensors` update was already merged.

I'm launching with `ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=alpha robotName2:=bravo robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotConfig2:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`.

Things I’ve noticed:

1. The ImageDisplay widget in the Gazebo GUI shows the flickering between the two images still. This is because…
2. Both X1 model instances are publishing their images on /model/X1/front/image\_raw, meaning that the model name is hardcoded into the topic somewhere. It should be the instance name instead.
3. On the ROS side, no images are coming through at all, even if I rename one of the robots to X1 so that I trick it into the looking at the right ignition topic.

Is there a different combination of branches/pull-requests I should be trying?
content.html:
I’ve switched to doing source builds of ignition-blueprint, ros1-ign-bridge, and subt so that I could test this, and this pull request did not fix the issue.

I'm specifically using the remap_default_topics branch of subt and the remove_world_name branch of ign-gazebo since it appears the ign-sensors update was already merged.

I'm launching with ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign robotName1:=alpha robotName2:=bravo robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1 robotConfig2:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1.

Things I’ve noticed:

  1. The ImageDisplay widget in the Gazebo GUI shows the flickering between the two images still. This is because…
  2. Both X1 model instances are publishing their images on /model/X1/front/image_raw, meaning that the model name is hardcoded into the topic somewhere. It should be the instance name instead.
  3. On the ROS side, no images are coming through at all, even if I rename one of the robots to X1 so that I trick it into the looking at the right ignition topic.

Is there a different combination of branches/pull-requests I should be trying?
